pullRequest.body:
Formalize Beta distribution, using Gamma distribution as a reference. Added real-valued beta wrapper, in the manner of gamma. Thanks to @EtienneC30 for help with casting real <-> complex.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [78a4ed69d8](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16773/commits/78a4ed69d8da49f5bdeffac6f9a80a7add8b73ce)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Probability.Distributions.Beta`|1960|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Beta`
`+ BetaIntegral_ofReal`
`+ BetaIntegral_ofReal_interval`
`+ Beta_integrand_intervalIntegrable`
`+ Beta_pos`
`+ betaCDFReal`
`+ betaCDFReal_eq_integral`
`+ betaCDFReal_eq_lintegral`
`+ betaMeasure`
`+ betaPDF`
`+ betaPDFReal`
`+ betaPDFReal_nonneg`
`+ betaPDF_eq`
`+ betaPDF_of_nonpos`
`+ betaPDF_of_nonpos_or_one_le`
`+ betaPDF_of_one_le`
`+ betaPDF_of_pos_lt_one`
`+ integrableOn_iff_ofReal`
`+ integrable_iff_ofReal`
`+ integral_re`
`+ intervalIntegrable_iff_ofReal`
`+ intervalIntegral_re`
`+ isProbabilityMeasureBeta`
`+ lintegral_Iio_eq_lintegral_Iic_add_Ioo`
`+ lintegral_betaPDF_eq_one`
`+ lintegral_betaPDF_of_nonpos`
`+ lintegral_betaPDF_of_one_le`
`+ measurable_betaPDFReal`
`+ setIntegral_re`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

@EtienneC30 I've addressed your comments about writing etc. For the new PRs, I just wanted to condense your feedback and make sure I understand this correctly:
PR1: `integrable_iff_ofReal` and similar for integrableOn, each in the file locations you suggested. integral_re and setIntegral_re as well. make equivalents for intervalIntegrable
PR2: `def Beta`, Beta_pos, BetaIntegral_ofReal, Beta_integrand_intervalIntegrable in `SpecialFunctions/Gamma/Beta.lean`
PR3: Beta formalization in `/Distributions/Beta.lean` 

Dependencies: (3) <- (1) + (2) and (2) <- (1). This PR will then get dropped in favor for 3, after 1 and 2 are merged. 

I understand having the dependencies specified in the PR, but in order for the code in the branch respective to PR3 for example to run, won't the PR1 + PR2 changes need to be present, meaning the diff will have multiple files? Or should I just do PR1, wait for finalization then PR2, then PR3?

You understood perfectly (indeed it was not very clear sorry for that). The way to go is as follows: indeed your modifications of PR1 and PR2 will appear in PR3 as well, making more diffs. But it does not matter because PR3 won't be reviewed while PR1 and PR2 aren't. When for example PR1 is merged to master, you should merge master into the branch of your PR2, that way the old diff of PR1 disappears. And once PR2 is merged to master, you can merge master to the branch of PR3.
Ok if this is the case, it seems easiest to just do these PR's one at a time, since there may be changes in the review of PR 1 etc. Will keep this PR open for tracking as I open 1, then 2, then 3
That's nice, but some lemmas are unnecessary in my opinion. Also, even though I reviewed this, please open another PR and make the modifications there.

That's a good job. My comments are mostly about conventions in naming, writing proofs etc. I sometimes put shorter writing, feel free to use it if you like it or discard it if you think it makes code less readable.

**[lint-style (comment with "bot fix style" to have the bot commit all style suggestions)]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (x : ) in (0)..1, x ^ (a - 1) * (1 - x) ^ (b - 1) > 0 := by ```
bot fix style

**[lint-style (comment with "bot fix style" to have the bot commit all style suggestions)]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion @IntervalIntegrable normedAddCommGroup (fun x x ^ (a - 1) * (1 - x) ^ (b - 1)) volume 0 1 := by ```
bot fix style

You should open a separate PR for these, as they have nothing to do with the `Beta` function, and make this PR depend on it (the hidden comment in the PR description explains how to indicate a dependency). I would put them in `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Integral.SetIntegral`, along their `RCLike` versions. Please also add an `intervalIntegral` version in `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Integral.IntervalIntegral`.

You should open yet another PR for the real `Beta` function you are adding. When modifying different files, it is almost always worth to open a separate PR for each file, it makes reviewing much easier.

Please open a fourth PR for these, again it is independent from the rest. I'd put the first in `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Function.L1Space`, next to `Integrable.ofReal`, the second in `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Integral.IntegrableOn`, and add an `IntervalIntegrable` version please in `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Integral.IntervalIntegral`.
In fact you can put these results and the ones about `integral_re` in the same PR.
This seems really artificial, you should integrate it in the proof of the lemma below which is the one we care about.

The reason I had this separated was since it was a fairly large chunk of code repeated btw the following lemma and Beta_pos (which I thought was a nice fact to add in the special functions). I will put this in that PR as opposed to this one
But in `Beta_pos` you can directly `rw` with `BetaIntegral_ofReal`.
If you have a result that's important in the context of a larger proof but artificial or useless elsewhere, usually the solution is to make it a `private` lemma or theorem.

I don't think this is the way to go here, as this lemma is the main part of the proof `BetaIntegral_ofReal` and is not used elsewhere (as I said, it is not necessary for `Beta_pos`), so I think it definitely makes more sense to put it directly in the proof of `BetaIntegral_ofReal`.

You can put all these in one `rw`:
```suggestion
rw [Beta, Complex.betaIntegral, BetaIntegral_ofReal_interval ha hb,
    intervalIntegral.integral_of_le (by norm_num), integral_Ioc_eq_integral_Ioo]
```
Again I think it's better if you get rid of this lemma and integrate it in the proof below.
agreed, done
Again you can put everything in one `rw`
Why don't you write it as an integral in `(0)..1`?
fixed

Wrong name for parameters (looks like a copy paste from Pareto )
```suggestion
  for `0  x  1` or `0` else, which is the probability density function of a beta distribution with
  parameters `a` and `b` (when `0 < a ` and `0 < b`).
```
This already exists in `Mathlib.Probability.Distributions.Gamma`, though I'm not sure it is the right place.
Yeah, I don't actually use this so it's clutter. If I were to separate PR this + the other lintegral_eq lemma that I do use, where would recommend I put this?

I think this is more common, same below
```suggestion
noncomputable def betaPDFReal (a b x : ) :  :=
```

Technically you don't need `ha` and `hb`, because if `a` or `b` is nonpos then `Beta a b` vanishes (integral of a non integrable function) so the pdf vanishes. But this result about `Beta` does not seem to exist, so if you want you can just write it as a todo.
I think you should write similar lemmas, one where you assume `x  0` and the other with `1  x`.

This is a bit more verbose but more explicit.
```suggestion
lemma betaPDF_of_nonpos_or_one_le {a b x : } (hx : x  0  1  x) : betaPDF a b x = 0 := by
```

I feel like skipping lines in the middle of proofs like this damages readability, because we also skip lines between different theorems, so please avoid those. There are others elsewhere.
```suggestion
    have hbeta:= Beta_pos ha hb
    positivity
```
fixed all of these

```suggestion
lemma betaPDF_of_pos_lt_one {a b x : } (hx1 : 0 < x) (hx2 : x < 1) :
    betaPDF a b x = ENNReal.ofReal (1 / (Beta a b) * x ^ (a - 1) * (1 - x) ^ (b - 1)) := by
```

```suggestion
lemma lintegral_betaPDF_of_one_le {x a b : } (hx : 1  x) :
     y in Ioi x, betaPDF a b y = 0 := by
```

```suggestion
@[measurability, fun_prop]
```

```suggestion
@[measurability, fun_prop]
 lemma stronglyMeasurable_betaPDFReal (a b : ) :
     StronglyMeasurable (betaPDFReal a b) :=
   (measurable_betaPDFReal a b).stronglyMeasurable
```
unrecognized function property (same as for pareto PR)
And same answer, sorry for those
This should be put with `lintegral_Iic_eq_lintegral_Iio_add_Icc`. You can also use `lintegral_Iic_eq_lintegral_Iio_add_Icc` to prove it.
got it

Add full stops to your docstrings please.
```suggestion
/-- The pdf of the beta distribution depending on its scale and rate. -/
```
got it, apologies

```suggestion
  have leftmid :  x in Iio 1, betaPDF a b x =
   x in Ioo 0 1, ENNReal.ofReal (1 / (Beta a b) * x ^ (a - 1) * (1 - x) ^ (b - 1)) := by rw [lintegral_Iio_eq_lintegral_Iic_add_Ioo _ zero_lt_one, left, middle, zero_add]
```

Don't hesitate to group your `rw`s!
```suggestion
  rw [ lintegral_add_compl _ measurableSet_Ici, compl_Ici, leftmid, right, zero_add,
     ENNReal.toReal_eq_one_iff,  integral_eq_lintegral_of_nonneg_ae]
```

```suggestion
    rw [integral_mul_left,  BetaIntegral_ofReal ha hb, one_div_mul_cancel (Beta_pos ha hb).ne']
```

Here is a bit shorter way, feel free to add it or not. However, please avoid to write multiline tactic blocks inside the arguments of a theorem. Use `apply` or `refine` instead.
```suggestion
    refine ae_of_all _ fun x hx  ?_
    convert betaPDFReal_nonneg ha hb x using 1
    rw [betaPDFReal, if_pos (mem_Ioo.1 hx)]
```
ah got it

```suggestion
    simp_rw [betaPDFReal, eq_true_intro hx, ite_true]

end BetaPDF
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Probability/Distributions): formalize Beta distribution
